title: Sad Trombone: Your Company's April Fools' Pranks Aren't Funny Anymore
summary: They backfire, get reported as fact and irritate customers. On April 1, 2018, Tesla Inc.'s founder and CEO Elon Musk tweeted a series of jokes. The funniest one? Tesla had gone bankrupt after failing to raise money. "So bankrupt, you can't believe it," he wrote. So funny the company's stock fell about 5% the next day.

title: Retirement Overhaul Gains Traction With Senate Bill
summary: House has introduced its own legislation; analysts say bill could be voted into law this year. The Senate on Monday introduced legislation to overhaul the U.S. retirement system, a sign that efforts to revamp retirement-savings plans are gaining traction.

title: U.S. and Chinese Manufacturing Stabilize, While Europe Lags Behind
summary: Indexes of factory activity suggest an uneven global growth outlook. Manufacturing activity in the world's two largest economies perked up in March, an antidote to financial-market fears of a coming global recession, though pockets of weakness remain and the outlook is uncertain.

title: New York to Set Up Panel to Explore Public Financing of Campaigns
summary: Provisions were approved as part of the state's $175.5 billion budget, but few were happy with outcome. Bowing to progressive pressure, New York lawmakers have created a new commission to craft a system of public campaign financing to reduce the influence of money in politics.

title: Don't Lock Hillary Up
summary: But no amnesty for anyone who abused his office because he wanted her to win.. Thanks to two lucky breaks, Hillary Clinton got away with political murder in 2016.

title: Legacy of an African Genocide
summary: Kagame has clung to power, knowing the world won't protect Rwanda's Tutsis.. April marks the 25th anniversary of the start of the Rwandan genocide, in which almost 800,000 Tutsis and moderate Hutus were indiscriminately set upon and murdered-in their homes, in schools, in churches and in the open air. Victims were often killed by machete, sometimes by neighbors they'd known for years.

title: Will Betomania Sweep America?
summary: His appeal testifies to the political power of militant vagueness.. A $6 million day of fundraising elevated former Rep. Beto O'Rourke from the fringes of speculative Democratic presidential politics to can't-be-ignored viability. Edging out Sen. Bernie Sanders's record chummed a media feeding frenzy.

title: Vale Fails to Get Safety Clearance for 18 Structures in Brazil
summary: The company's inspectors refuse to guarantee stability of dams, dikes. SÃO PAULO- Vale SA's safety inspectors refused to guarantee the stability of at least 18 of its dams and dikes in Brazil as a crisis of confidence in the miner's structures deepens following its deadly dam collapse in January.

title: What Causes Cancer? It's Complicated
summary: Each case of the disease is the result of several factors, and it's usually hard to blame a specific exposure.. A San Francisco jury decided last month that a plaintiff's case of non-Hodgkin lymphoma was caused by Bayer's Roundup weedkiller, which contains glyphosate, a probable carcinogen; last Wednesday the panel awarded him $80 million in damages. Less than a week before, a jury in Oakland, Calif., awarded $29 million to a woman who claimed her mesothelioma was caused by asbestos in Johnson & Johnson 's talc powder. Last year in Missouri, Johnson & Johnson was ordered to pay $4.7 billion to 22 plaintiffs who believed the powder caused ovarian cancer.

title: A Lesson in the Virtue of a Stable Currency
summary: Speculators keep shorting the Hong Kong dollar, but they don't understand how a currency board works.. If you believe everything you read in the financial press, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, or HKMA, has its back against the wall. The Hong Kong dollar is supposedly under attack, forcing the HKMA to defend it. As a result, the authority burned through almost $2 billion of reserves, in U.S. dollars, in March alone. Sensing a devaluation, the bears have awoken from hibernation to speculate.

title: What I Learned on Safari: Ignore the Fine Print
summary: How could my sister shop while I faced a lioness?. Conventional wisdom will tell you to read waivers carefully before signing your life away. Sometimes it's better to jump blindly into adventure. Eleven years ago my friend Tuomo convinced me to tag along on a South African safari. I agreed, trusting he wouldn't put me in danger.

title: New York Launches a Cybercrime Brigade
summary: A new citywide initiative aims to coordinate digital law-enforcement efforts.. In a little more than a month last year, cybercriminals temporarily debilitated Atlanta's computer systems, disrupted Baltimore's 911 emergency system, and forced Colorado's Department of Transportation offline. Atlanta's cyberattack alone cost taxpayers an estimated $17 million, according to a city report. These attacks transpired amid a yearlong barrage of international cybercrimes against hospitals, governments, banks and utilities that exposed the personal information of millions of people, shut down large server networks, and caused significant financial loss.

title: Joe Biden's Identity Reckoning
summary: He may have been VP, but he's old, white, male and heterosexual.. Spare a sympathetic thought for Joe Biden. He may have unmatched government experience as Vice President (eight years) and Senator (36 years), but he's also old, white, male, a heterosexual with no apparent gender ambiguity, and he's also not a socialist. This failure to check any box of modern progressive identity politics may end up disqualifying him as a Democratic presidential nominee even though he probably has the best chance to defeat Donald Trump.

title: Tension Over the Taiwan Strait
summary: More evidence that the U.S. ally needs F-16V jets to deter China.. Two Chinese J-11 fighter jets crossed the Taiwan Strait's "median line" on Sunday, stoking a 10-minute standoff with Taiwanese jets in the island's airspace. Taipei's Ministry of Foreign Affairs called the incident "intentional, reckless, and provocative," and it underscores why President Trump should bolster Taiwan's defenses with a sale of American F-16s.

title: An Obama Zombie Returns
summary: A case study in how liberal judges protect regulatory overreach.. The Administrative Procedure Act is intended to ensure regulatory due process, but Democrats have weaponized the law to entrench Obama Administration diktats that do the opposite. Witness a judge's order last month reinstating a payroll sweep that has left employers scrambling.

title: When Taxing the Affluent Isn't Enough
summary: As more rich taxpayers leave New York, Cuomo slams everyone else.. Democrats now control New York's entire state government, and on Sunday Gov. Andrew Cuomo signed off on a $175.5 billion budget he described as "probably the broadest, most sweeping state plan that we have done." He certainly spares no taxpayer.

title: Pentagon Suspends F-35 Fighter Deal With Turkey
summary: Defense officials cite Turkey's pursuit of Russian antiaircraft system. The U.S. is suspending delivery of support equipment and supplies to Turkey for F-35 jet fighters because of Ankara's pursuit of a Russian antiaircraft system over repeated U.S. objections, the Pentagon announced Monday.

title: U.K. Business Sentiment Declines as Brexit Uncertainty Continues
summary: Companies report lower sales growth and cash flows, BCC survey finds. summary: Move follows two existing investigations into KPMG and comes ahead of structural change to oversight of U.K. audit sector. The U.K. watchdog for accounting and audit on Tuesday launched an independent review into the governance, controls and culture at KPMG LLP's U.K. audit unit.

summary: Critics see the panel as a rubber stamp for the mayor's agenda. New York state's new budget deal grants Mayor Bill de Blasio his wish for a three-year extension of control over New York City schools, but some education advocates said Monday that parents should have been given more power.

summary: E-commerce giant is pushing to spur sales and change grocer's high-cost image in competitive grocery market. summary: DeNA Co. has developed an app that uses gaming technology to direct taxi drivers to streets where they are most likely to find customers. title: NIMH Policy on Schizophrenia Is Rational
summary: We at the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) updated our schizophrenia statistics webpage to reflect the most up-to-date range of schizophrenia-prevalence estimates drawn from the scientific literature.. In "Where Did the Schizophrenics Go?" (op-ed, March 27) E. Fuller Torrey and Wendy Simmons attempt to revive a settled controversy by engaging in speculation. Proper estimates of the number of people with schizophrenia are created by scientists guided by data from other government agencies, as well as community-based studies. In 2018 we at the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) updated our schizophrenia statistics webpage to reflect the most up-to-date range of schizophrenia-prevalence estimates drawn from the scientific literature. On that page we also appropriately discuss the uncertainty in these estimates.

title: Cuomo: Florida Gets Welfare From New York
summary: New York doesn't add to Florida's bills-we pay them. In 2017 Florida took nearly $46 billion more from the federal government than it contributed.. Scott argues in support of the 2017 tax reform's unprecedented cap on state and local tax (SALT) deductibility. This represents a tax increase of more than $600 billion nationally, with dire implications for New York. The senator claims that the cap "stops high-tax states from burdening the rest of us with their irresponsible decisions."

title: Kellogg to Sell Keebler, Other Brands to Ferrero

title: Spend Enough on Defense to Meet the Threat
summary: We need to spend more now to deter our great-power adversaries over the next generation.. Daniel R. DePetris wants a more focused American foreign policy and a right-sized military pursuing "smarter" policies and consuming less money ("Pentagon Must Spend Its Money Better, Not More of It," Letters, March 21). Everyone should want that, but there are problems. While the U.S. tries to get its grand strategy together, and the Democratic Party wants to spend ever more expanding the welfare state, the armed forces have been effectively stripped of adequate funds for future development and current readiness.

title: Maybe Life Insurance Isn't the Killer App After All
summary: Sounds too good to be true. And it is. The problem is that 57-year-olds don't qualify for Medicare, not to mention that most insurance companies don't cover expensive, lifesaving drugs like Yervoy.. In "Heath Care's Killer App: Life Insurance" (op-ed, March 21), Dana P. Goldman and Darius Lakdawalla make an enticing case that life insurance can play a game-changing role in lowering costs and saving lives. The real-life example that they use involves a 57-year-old man with metastatic skin cancer taking a breakthrough new drug called Yervoy that costs about $120,000 a year. They calculate that with Medicare paying $96,000, and the insurer paying the patent's out-of-pocket costs of $24,000, the insurance company would come out way ahead because the policyholder would survive his cancer and continue paying premiums for years to come. Researchers have calculated that new drugs like Yervoy could save life-insurance companies $6.8 billion a year. Sounds too good to be true. And it is. The problem is that 57-year-olds don't qualify for Medicare, not to mention that most insurance companies don't cover expensive, lifesaving drugs like Yervoy.

title: Doublespeak on Diversity
summary: Basically, "we excluded him because we are an inclusive institution.". I really enjoyed the March 22 'Notable and Quotable' from the Cambridge University spokesperson. summary: A politically incorrect movie overcomes social-media obstacles and dismissive film critics to score at the box office.. What would we do without experts? title: In Triumph or Tragedy, Views of Trump Don't Waver
summary: President's job-approval ratings have stayed within 9-point range since taking office, a smaller variance than for any modern predecessors. In the topsy-turvy, ever-changing, never-quiet era of President Trump, there is one constant: Americans' views of President Trump himself.

title: Fugitive Tycoon Fights Hong Kong's Planned Extradition Changes
summary: Joseph Lau files for a judicial review to challenge the proposal that would allow suspects to be handed over to other Chinese jurisdictions. HONG KONG-A fugitive billionaire has launched a legal challenge against proposed changes to Hong Kong's extradition law that would allow suspects to be handed over to other Chinese jurisdictions.

title: Laurie Metcalf Shares a Few of Her Favorite Things
summary: The acclaimed actor on objects of inspiration. "The painting in the middle is of my ranch in Idaho. I've had the property for 20 years. There are deer, moose and bears wandering around. There was even a mountain lion recently. I found the antler in the front yard of one of the cabins. We're city folk; we go and pretend to ranch. Everything is like an accident waiting to happen when we're up there. My friend Jimmi Simpson gave me the framed picture of the monkeys in the back. A few years ago, he and I did a play called Trevor, which was about a woman who lives with a chimpanzee. He played the chimp. He gave me that picture on closing night. To the left is a lithograph [of a line of figures] by the actor and artist Martin Mull. Every time I walk past it, I have to get within three inches of it to make sure it's not a photograph-it's that realistic. The photo in front is of my four kids. About 10 years ago, my eldest daughter, Zoe Perry, took the other three kids down to Sears. Zoe knew how funny it would be to have their picture taken. It's always in whatever dressing room I'm sitting in. My older son made the 'Tony Award' for me when I was nominated for a play called The Other Place. I lost. He was in Idaho watching and made the award using a wood-burning kit. I bought the shell to the left at the Rose Bowl Flea Market in Pasadena about 10 years ago. I find it mesmerizing. The scripts to the left are in book form. One is Three Tall Women, which I worked on last year, and the other is Long Day's Journey into Night, from 2012. Sometimes I like to go back and see what notes I've made in the margins. For my new play, Hillary and Clinton, my script is in the form of a big old manuscript in a three-ring binder. The booklets are representative of all the theater I've done over the years. It's my favorite way to work. Finally, the multicolored card was something my other son gave me. It's one of those little things that wouldn't mean anything to anyone else. It says, 'Happy Mother's Day, Mom. Thanks for being my mom. You're still a chump, but I love you.' " -As told to Thomas Gebremedhin

title: Linda Cardellini, Sam Gold, Mike Leigh and More on Silver Linings
summary: WSJ. asks six luminaries to weigh in on a single topic. This month: Silver Linings. "My mother always forced me to look for the silver lining. No kid wants to hear those perky lessons about the bright side when she's busy sulking, but as I got older, looking for the silver lining became a reflex. It became the thing that made it possible for me to do almost everything-it gave me my career. When I was doing the Cathy comic strip, I was finding the humor in unfunny moments. I think that women are genetically programmed to do that. We find the seeds of hope and build life even when things are bad. Then we hand them down to the next generation like china. The ability to see silver linings gave me perspective and resolve. It helped me look for answers instead of caving in, and it gave me a great sense of gratitude for bad situations. I go to gratitude first and then catch up with the misery later on!"

title: These 'March Madness' Souvenirs Are Hot. A Little Too Hot.
summary: Resume Subscription. ANAHEIM, Calif.-What's black and blue and walked all over? The hottest souvenir at the NCAA men's basketball tournament.

title: Farewell, Duke Zion. Hello, Knicks Zion?
summary: Michigan State stops Duke and sends college basketball's best player home before the Final Four. He will be missed.. I already miss Zion.

title: There Are Five Different Races in Streaming TV. Here's Where Apple Fits In.
summary: In the U.S., Silicon Valley and media titans are competing in categories from subscription entertainment to hardware to online-TV bundles. Apple Inc. has entered the streaming-television arena. But who exactly is it competing with?

title: This Time Probably Isn't Different for Fannie, Freddie
summary: Despite recent moves from Congress and the Trump administration, housing-finance reform remains a long way off. Shares of housing-finance giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have rallied this year on expectations they could soon be released from government control. The exuberance is premature.

title: Mining Projects Become Flash Points in Southern Europe
summary: Big plans, with promises of job creation, run up against environmental concerns; a Spanish village tries to survive. RETORTILLO, Spain-Half a century ago, almost 1,000 people lived in this village in western Spain. Today, roughly 100 people call it home, as young residents flee in search of jobs in Madrid and beyond.

title: Discovery Aims to Be the Netflix of Nonfiction Streaming
summary: Company unveils natural-history-themed offering; plans a 'Peloton of food' and another service with HGTV stars Chip and Joanna Gaines. Discovery Inc. has expanded its push into subscription streaming TV with a new natural-history-themed video service, part of the media company's bet that consumers will pay a few dollars a month for the nonfiction programming they love.

title: China Closes Loophole in Fentanyl Rules
summary: Beijing is moving ahead to meet a promise made to President Trump amid trade negotiations. BEIJING-China is clamping down on more substances related to the deadly opioid fentanyl, moving ahead to meet a promise made to President Trump amid U.S. and Chinese negotiations to resolve the countries' trade fight.

title: How Amazon Goes Small to Make It in New York
summary: Vertical operations and more robots signal the future of e-commerce fulfillment as companies look to get closer to more customers. STATEN ISLAND, N.Y.- Amazon.com Inc.'s first major New York City distribution center is nearly the size of 15 football fields and can spit out more than one million items a day during its busiest period.

title: Airbnb Takes Stake in Indian Hotel-Booking Startup Oyo
summary: The size of Airbnb's investment is between $100 million and $200 million. MUMBAI-Home-sharing company Airbnb Inc. said it had invested in Indian hotel-booking startup Oyo Hotels & Homes, expanding its reach across Asia.

title: The Missing Piece in Big Food's Innovation Puzzle
summary: Food companies talk a lot about new products, so why don't they spend money on them?. The world's biggest food companies harp on about the need to come up with new products. But their innovation budgets are shrinking. Investors can benefit from the contradiction if they look further up the food chain.

title: How Those Chinese Bonds Got Into Your Portfolio
summary: Investors have a responsibility to scrutinize the growing importance of index providers. Old-school active fund managers were expensive and their performance unreliable. But the new school comes with the risk that investors buy into assets for no good reason at all.

title: Fed's Kashkari Says It Isn't Time to Cut Rates
summary: Minneapolis Fed president believes central bank is in the right place as officials assess health of expansion. Neel Kashkari, one of the Federal Reserve's most consistent opponents of interest-rate increases, says it isn't the time for the central bank to cut borrowing costs.

title: GSK Finance Chief Hands Baton to Successor as Centralization Efforts Bear Fruit
summary: Simon Dingemans leaves the top finance post at the U.K. drug company after eight years in the role on Monday. When Simon Dingemans took over as chief financial officer at GlaxoSmithKline PLC eight years ago, the pharmaceuticals giant didn't have a unified information technology system or standardized financial processes.

title: Spike in Motorists Hitting, Killing State Troopers
summary: National, state authorities urge caution after 14 trooper deaths this year, up from nine in all of 2017. Federal and state highway officials are warning drivers to be more cautious amid a troubling and unexplained rise this year in the number of state troopers struck and killed while going about their duties outside their vehicles.

title: China's Entrepreneurs Are Left High and Dry Despite a Flood of Credit
summary: Credit easing has freed up hundreds of billions of dollars but banks are reluctant to lend to struggling private companies. SHANGHAI-Ineffective monetary policy is hindering Beijing's efforts to pep up growth, with little of the extra cash it has pumped into the financial system filtering into the real economy.

title: Vietnamese Woman Pleads Guilty in Killing of Kim Jong Un's Half-Brother
summary: Doan Thi Huong could be released as soon as next month. SHAH ALAM, Malaysia-A Vietnamese woman accused of assassinating the half-brother of North Korea's leader pleaded guilty to a reduced charge of causing hurt with a dangerous weapon and could be released as soon as next month, according to her lawyer.

title: Avoid Catching China's Spring Fever
summary: March brought some good economic news from China-but this should be taken with a dollop of salt. Is spring in the air for the Chinese economy? Unreliable data is a poor guide.

title: Japan Chooses Reiwa as Era Name for Next Emperor
summary: Reiwa era will begin May 1 when Crown Prince Naruhito becomes emperor. TOKYO-Japan's government drew from a nearly 1,300-year-old set of poems, some of the earliest in the Japanese language, in choosing the name of the new era starting May 1 when Crown Prince Naruhito assumes the throne.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Raid on North Korea's Madrid Embassy a 'Grave Terrorist Attack,' Pyongyang Says
summary: North Korea urges Spanish authorities to investigate the February intrusion by members of the Cheollima Civil Defense. SEOUL-North Korea called a late February intrusion of its Spanish embassy a "grave terrorist attack" and an "act of extortion," marking Pyongyang's first public remarks about a puzzling raid by secretive dissidents hoping to topple the regime of Kim Jong Un.

title: The Final Four Is Set After Michigan State Defeats Duke
summary: Spartans' upset completes a lineup that also includes Auburn, Virginia and Texas Tech. WASHINGTON-Central Florida developed the playbook for how to beat Duke, proving to the rest of the country that the juggernaut of college basketball could fall. Virginia Tech added another chapter to that blueprint less than a week later, making the Blue Devils look not just beatable, but vulnerable.

title: Cuomo Tightens Control Over Board Tied to Amazon Deal's Undoing
summary: Governor secures budget provision that increases his hold on the Public Authorities Control Board. Still stung by the demise of Amazon.com Inc.'s plan to build a campus in Queens, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo successfully pushed a budget provision that would give him more power over the state board that held sway over the project.
